author: McDumDum

text:
I loved this song, this game, in 1997 when my friend introduced me to it back in high school.  It's very dark, yet bright and goofy...some parts are like if Leonard Cohen teamed up with Bob Dylan did music for that Satan scene from The Adventures of Mark Twain & Huck Finn stop motion claymation movie.

Yeah...I'm kind of going out on a limb with that comparison, anyone else see/hear it???  If you get it, totally like & be my friend!

author: electricmastro

text: @HardWarUK I agree: The reason? Because since 2005 (I'd say even earlier, 2002, but let's say 2005), game's prices to produce have reached so high that taking risks is no longer feasible. Before, one game selling badly would cause the studio to try harder next time. Nowadays, one game selling badly will make a studio go bankrupt, so studios tend to go for tried and tested formulas. The only ones who can still get brave are indie developers. VALVe is also still a fan of taking risks.
